intro: Styrax tinifolius, commonly known as the sweetgum, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its star-shaped leaves, which are typically five-lobed and have a smooth, waxy texture. The tree produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into spiky, spherical fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age, and it is known for its rapid growth rate. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world for landscaping purposes.
